data.title: GOAL v. RESULTS
questions: In this phase, compare the project’s goal with the results achieved.
What did we set out to achieve? What was the goal/objective?
What specific results were produced? What was accomplished?
How was success measured? To what extent was this project ‘successful’?
What helped make it a ‘success’?
What diminished its ‘success’?

data.title: SPECIFIC OBSERVATIONS
questions: In this phase, identify specific things which worked and didn’t work.
What went well? What worked?  What contributed to or caused that?
What didn’t work or go well? What contributed to or caused that?
What actually happened? How did what happen vary from the plan?
To what extent was the scope of work clearly defined and pursued?
To what extent were stakeholders’ expectations clear and measurable?
To what extent was each deliverable achieved? Scorecard (red, yellow, green)?
To what extent were individuals held accountable for their deliverables?
To what extent was the plan, timeline and deadline realistic?
To what extent were tasks assigned and responsibilities clear?
To what extent were the estimated durations of tasks accurate?
Which tasks required less time, more time or about the right time?
Did the risks identified and assessed in advance prove accurate?
What risks were not identified in advance? How significant were they?
To what extent were contingency plans implemented? How successfully?
What changes in scope occurred over the course of the project?
How did changes in scope impact the project? How were they handled?

data.title: PEOPLE + LEADERSHIP
questions: In this phase, review how people fared on the project and its leadership.
To what extent were stakeholders’ expectations met?
What stakeholder interests or concerns went unaddressed, if any?
To what extent was there a communication plan? If so, how was it used?
Who needs to be recognized and/or rewarded for their contributions?
Did anything on the project impact trust or interpersonal relationships?
How did the project impact morale and confidence in future projects?
How would we summarize the people aspect of this project?
To what extent did the leader respect and engage people?
To what extent did the leader consistently hold people accountable?
To what extent did the leader practice transparent communication?
How would we evaluate the leadership of this project?

data.title: OBJECTIVE + AGENDA
questions: In this phase, document lessons learned and raise the bar for next time.
What insights were gained? What lessons were learned?
What were your personal lessons learned?
How might risks be better identified in the future?
What advice (with hindsight) would we have given ourselves at the kick-off of this project?
What 2 or 3 key lessons would we share with others doing similar projects?
What will we do differently next time?
How will we raise the bar?
